Overview

Wieland - Creating Value for Generations!

 

Wieland is a global leader in copper and copper alloy manufacturing, processing, and distribution. We provide a large product and service portfolio including power, automotive, ammunition, coinage, construction materials, refrigeration, electronics and many other industries. To us, metal is more than material.

 

Wieland's Cultural Values

Wieland’s culture is what makes for a fun and rewarding place to work! As a company, we benefit daily from our employees' knowledge and abilities. With our cultural vision, we place our core values at the heart of everything we do: safety, ambition, optimism, reliability, ownership, diversity, & respect.

 

Wieland is hiring a Learning Technology Specialist. The Learning Technology Specialist will be responsible for ensuring a seamless learning experience for employees by maintaining accurate data in the Learning Management System (LMS), providing first level technical troubleshooting for system end users, and identifying opportunities to optimize learning processes. This role reports to the Manager, Learning Technology, & Instructional Design.

 

This position may be hired at the Learning Specialist I (entry-level) or Learning Specialist II (more experienced) level, depending on the candidate’s experience, capabilities, and overall fit for the role.

 

This role is based at Wieland’s North American Headquarters in Louisville, KY; however, hybrid, onsite, or fully remote work arrangements may be considered based on the selected candidate’s experience, role alignment, and business needs.

Responsibilities

Learning Technology Specialist Responsibilities:

Maintain the Learning Management System (LMS) to efficiently manage and deliver learning and training content, track learner progress, and ensure regional compliance with training requirements.

  • Oversee day-to-day operations of the LMS and assist with configuration and maintenance tasks as directed.
  • Maintain established, regional training curricula and learning assignments to ensure compliance.
  • Perform key weekly or bi-weekly audits to ensure compliance and minimize training gaps, including but not limited to position audits, new hire audits, and location change audits.
  • Maintain and deliver standard training reports and analytics for departments and leaders, under the direction of the Manager, Learning Technology & Instructional Design.
  • Assign and assist with updating and re-versioning training curricula requirements in the learning management system (LMS) for intended audiences.

Provide technical support for end users and Regional Local LMS Administrators across multiple functional areas, helping to ensure alignment with organizational learning strategies, operational efficiency, and continuous improvement in learning technologies and methodologies.

  • Act as primary technical support contact for system users, including monitoring the L&D inbox and Matrix 42 ticket queue, and escalating complex issues to the appropriate teams.
  • Liaise between end users, the IT department, HRIS, and other key stakeholders in technical support processes.
  • Onboard & orient new Local System Admins to key Cornerstone functionalities such as Reporting 2.0, Learning Assignment Tool, and Express Class.

Maintain content in Learning Management System (LMS) and other relevant content authoring tools or key online resource hubs.

  • Upload, organize, and manage digital learning materials within specified naming conventions and vendor guidelines, ensuring sources are correctly categorized and visible to appropriate audiences.
  • Assist in developing, deploying, and curating training materials and Orange step guides to users on how to effectively use the LMS.
  • Provide support for eLearning design and updates as capabilities allow.

Perform additional duties as assigned to support the organization’s objectives and the Learning and Development functional strategic initiatives.

 

Learning Technology Specialist Qualifications:

  • Ability to work in a dynamic environment with evolving priorities and time sensitive deliverables.
  • Minimum (2) years of experience in data management or a technical administrative role, preferably in learning and development.
  • Practical knowledge and application of relationship data bases and data management; previous experience with Cornerstone LMS preferred.
  • Experience in building training guides, work instructions, or reference documentation preferred.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, Organizational Development, or related field or equivalent experience specific to learning management system administration.

 

Learning Technology Specialist Competencies:

  • Attention to Detail: Ability to diligently attend to details and pursue the utmost quality in accomplishing tasks.

Desired Competency Level: Intermediate (independent execution, minimal guidance)

  • Planning & Organizing: Ability to define tasks and milestones to achieve objectives while ensuring optimal use of resources to achieve those objectives.

Desired Competency Level: Intermediate (independent execution, minimal guidance)

  • Problem Solving & Decision Making: Ability to identify, analyze, and address challenges or opportunities by gathering relevant information, evaluating options, and making informed, timely, and effective decisions in approved areas.

Desired Competency Level: Developing (independent execution, minimal guidance)

  • Communication & Influence: Ability to convey ideas, information, and perspectives clearly, effectively, and persuasively to diverse audiences while fostering understanding, engagement, and alignment. 

Desired Competency Level: Developing (independent execution, minimal guidance)

  • Learning Management Software & Technology: Ability to use software for efficiently creating, managing, and delivering learning and training content, tracking learner progress, user management, and system configuration.

Desired Competency Level: Developing (independent execution, minimal guidance)

    Joining Wieland’s team gives you…

    • Sustainability- Wieland continues to break ground with eco-friendly solutions and push the barrier in sustainability for future generations.

     

     

     

    Wieland is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.   Come join Wieland today and help us continue to build a global corporation we are all proud to belong to.
